channel.title: Doors have no options after opening
channel.description: I'm currently going around the world making doors able to open and close but I can only do half the work because once they open I have no options to close it. I don't have much knowledge with coding but I'd imagine it has something to do with the clickingbuttons, the source I'm using is PI.

item.title: Doors have no options after opening
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

Don’t use doors.cfg

Use something like this it is easier

https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=652836.0

Read full topic
item.source: Doors have no options after opening

item.title: Doors have no options after opening
item.dc:creator: @zRickyz zRickyz
item.description:
@zRickyz wrote:

The tut I followed just said to add the door to doors.cfg and put the door ID as a case in ActionHandler.java. I only added one of those doors so the creator of PI seemed to be using this method as well.

case 1530: case 1531: case 1533: case 1534: case 11712: case 11711: case 11707: case 11708: case 6725: case 3198: case 3197: Server.objectHandler.doorHandling(objectType, c.objectX, c.objectY, 0); break;

Read full topic
item.source: Doors have no options after opening

item.title: Doors have no options after opening
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Then show the code for that object id in the ActionHandler.

Read full topic
item.source: Doors have no options after opening

item.title: Doors have no options after opening
item.dc:creator: @zRickyz zRickyz
item.description:
@zRickyz wrote:

The method I’m using is going in ActionHandler.java adding the door ID where the other ones are and going into doors.cfg and adding the door info. That all went smoothly and the door opens and looks great but as soon as it’s opened the door is visible but when you click it the yellow shows up not red so it’s basically not there and right clicking it gives no options

Read full topic
item.source: Doors have no options after opening

item.title: Doors have no options after opening
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

My guess is you’re probably replacing that object, with a similar looking object, without options (ie. a door you can act upon, and a static door with no options). Check your object ids. In fact, I don’t believe you need to change the object ID at all. just changes it’s orientation (N, E, S, W).

Read full topic
item.source: Doors have no options after opening
